dcterms:creator: S. Yu
D. Tan
T. Tan
dcterms:description: CASIA-B gait dataset is one of the popular public gait databases created by the Institute of Automation, Chinese Academy of Sciences. It contains 124 subjects, each with six sequences captured at 11 views, from 0° to 180° with an 18° interval between two nearest views. The dataset includes three different conditions: normal walking, walking with a bag, and walking with a coat.
dcterms:title: CASIA-B

dcterms:creator: H. Iwama
M. Okumura
Y. Makihara
Y. Yagi
dcterms:description: OU-ISIR Large Population Dataset is a very large dataset containing 4007 subjects ranging from 1 to 94 years old. It includes two sequences under normal walking conditions and is designed to evaluate the performance of gait recognition.
dcterms:title: OU-ISIR Large Population Dataset

dcterms:creator: N. Takemura
Y. Makihara
D. Muramatsu
T. Echigo
Y. Yagi
dcterms:description: OU-MVPL is a multi-view large population gait dataset that includes performance evaluation for cross-view gait recognition. It contains 14 views and is used to study gait recognition across different angles.
dcterms:title: OU-MVPL
